metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15954 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
bchunk (related to BinChunker) 1.2.0 and 1.2.1 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow (with a resultant invalid free) and crash when processing a malformed CUE (.cue) file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bchunk - 1.2.0-12+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bchunk package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-12+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
